item.title: Manager, Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Data Analytics Manager will assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. 

What will you do?

  • Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.
  • Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). 
  • Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. 
  • Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. 
  • Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit.
  • Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.
  • Create and maintain foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Support the prioritization of analytics based on areas of best return; deciding on accept/decline analytics and automation activities for the Lab to execute on; hosting regular cadence with lab stakeholders; ensuring analytics initiatives are tracked in central repository.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors
  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.
  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team and global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis
  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors

What do you need to succeed?

  • Bachelor’s Degree; Masters or Advanced Degree preferred
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Proficient in auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • A strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.
  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Strong knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Expert data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • 2+ years of experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills: Ability to explain complex Audit and Technological concepts to various stakeholders ranging from Specialists to Executives
  • Strong aptitude for Collaboration, Stakeholder Management and Relationship Management
  • Domain Knowledge and capacity to research and effectively understand innovative concepts, including but not limited to Emerging Financial Risk and Regulation, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, UX/UI, and Data Visualization

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $110,000 - $190,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

  • Drives RBC’s high performance culture
  • Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals
  • Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USAUDIT23

Job Summary

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-11-16-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-01-16-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

item.title: Data Analytics Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Analyst

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms.  Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s).  Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit.  Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions.  Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

What will you do?

Analytics Lab Support

  • Assist in the creation and maintenance of foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors.

Business Case Development and Adoption Support

  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.

Technological use and Reuse

  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team.
  • Support global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis.

Leadership & People Development

  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors.

What do you need to succeed?

Overall

  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • Strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Knowledge of auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.

Technical experience:

  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Working knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Working knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficient data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Proficient data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark

Leadership and People Management experience:

  • Demonstrates they have successfully worked in inclusive and diverse work teams
  • Proven ability to multitask and prioritize activities; across borders and cultures
  • Experience working as a team member on a special project, over an extended period of time

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $65,000 - $105,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USAUDIT23

Job Summary

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals. These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

item.title: Associate, Investment Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate, Investment Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

RBC Wealth Management is one of the world’s top 10 largest wealth managers. RBC Wealth Management directly serves affluent, high-net-worth (HNW) and ultra-high net worth (UHNW) clients in Canada, the United States and select international markets with a full suite of banking, investment, trust and other wealth management solutions. The business also provides asset management products and services directly and through RBC and third party distributors to institutional and individual clients, through its RBC Global Asset Management business (which includes BlueBay Asset Management).

Are you looking to help move forward the advanced analytics capabilities of an investment group from early stages to beyond? Our team is responsible for developing and maintaining performance, risk and advanced analytics reporting for RBC Wealth Management Investment & Trading group (I&T) in Canada. If you are detail-oriented, eager to learn, ready to apply both investment and technical knowledge skills, this Associate position in our Investment Management Analytics team might be the right opportunity for you.  Help us deliver the best portfolio and market insights, in addition to the tools to support the needs of our portfolio managers and strategists. 

What will you do?

  • Learn the business as usual for performance and risk management to support our investment committees.

  • Help improve processes as we integrate new datasets to automate business as usual where possible.

  • Support the development of our data pipelines and methods to deliver insights (web, tableau, excel, etc) to our various equity and multi-asset portfolio specialists.

  • Support I&T’s ability to capitalize on opportunities to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of RBC Wealth Management’s investment strategy by partnering with the Investments & Trading team and various groups across RBC focused on improving our analytics processes and capabilities.

  • Ensure accuracy and quality through production of summaries and reports while meeting timelines on recurring reporting needs.

  • Ensure policies and procedures are implemented and documented.

  • Conduct Ad hoc projects, data extractions or analysis as directed.

  • Be a part of a start-up like setting where fast-fail is highly valued, level of uncertainty is high and requirements are not all defined in advance (iterative feedback loop).                                  

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce, Finance, Economics, Computer Science or related quantitative discipline (e.g., Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics)

  • Experience/interest in performance reporting and analysis.

  • Experience/interest in risk reporting and analysis

  • Pursuing/interest in Chartered Financial Analyst or other finance/risk training or designation.

  • Knowledge of SQL and at least one programming language (Python, R, Matlab, C, C#, Java, etc).

  • Knowledge of financial systems (FactSet, Bloomberg, Refinitiv, etc) and working with time series data from these vendors.

Nice to Have

  • Experience using Git, Github, Zenhub. Experience in agile design methodologies and frameworks.

  • Experience working with Tableau.

  • Experience using cloud-enabled technologies such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), specifically S3, Athena, EMR, RDS, or other AWS database related products.

  • Experience with big data analytics technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka); experience compiling, manipulating and analyzing large datasets, with a good understanding of data processing frameworks.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-01-18-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-03-03-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Sr. Manager Product Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager Product Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?​

As the Senior Manager, Product Analytics, you will be responsible for supporting the analytics and data needs of the Personal Lending Product team. This includes providing actionable insights, data-driven product strategy, and recommendations to senior leadership to drive growth and profitability.

What will you do?​

  • Develop and maintain origination pricing strategies for Unsecured Lines of Credit, Education Financing and Installment loans to ensure an optimal balance between profitability and acquisition volumes
  • Identify and execute on price optimization opportunities for revolving credit product portfolios to achieve profitability targets and improve KPIs.
  • Monitor competitor activity and develop benchmarking to inform pricing strategies.
  • Work closely with partner groups to manage the pricing lifecycle (strategy, execution, performance monitoring and refinement) for all PL products
  • Support the analytics needs of the PL business, including developing a deeper understanding of segment economics and customer behaviour, support for business cases, deep dives on new product innovation and special projects
  • Provide ad hoc analysis with actionable insights to enable strategic, fact-based discussions and facilitate better decision-making within PL

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 3+ years related work experience developing pricing strategies and financial models
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics (SAS / SQL)
  • Strategic mindset and ability to own the development and execution of pricing strategies
  • Ability to demonstrate proficiency for critical thinking and analytics
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice-To-Have

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Business, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, etc.) Programming experience with R and/or Python
  • Credit fundamentals including risk modeling and credit strategy development
  • Subject matter expertise on developing price sensitivity and propensity mode

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-11-22-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-01-30-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Analyst, Client Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analyst, Client Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Client Data Analytics is part of the Controls & Governance team of the Client & Data Management Group (C&DMG), provides monitoring and performance analysis for the all aspects of client onboarding and refresh activities. The analyst works with stakeholders to produce metrics for effective monitoring, timely reporting and identification of action plans around KPIs and KRIs.

What will you do?

  • Support the delivery of business analytics

  • Ensure data is consistently maintained to agreed operational and regulatory standards throughout the client lifecycle.

  • Help maintain & monitor an inventory of data & key controls showing ownership,
    frequency and SLA’s across the client lifecycle.

  • Support the development of actionable ongoing management reporting that is focused on trends and includes proactive identification and reporting of emerging risks (KPIs and KRIs).

  • Monitor the metrics from the risk and control framework and ensure that the ongoing health of the processes are monitored

  • Ensure sustainable remedial action when issues are identified.

  • Proactively identify operational risks/control deficiencies in the business and opportunities to improve the team & client experience.

  • Collaborate to create processes and monitoring tools, following a risk based approach including appropriate exception management and escalation policies.

  • Support ongoing reporting that is focused on trends and emerging risks
    from different sources of information across business units.

  • Support the creation of a consolidated view of risk and performance, including initiatives, compliance deficiencies and corrective action.

What you need to succeed?

  • Undergraduate degree

  • 2 - 3+ years of Capital Markets experience

  • Quantitative analytic skills, including experience with data analysis and data presentation

  • Strong database experience and GUI development experience

  • Expertise in one or more of Python, VBA, and Tableau

  • MS Office, with particular expertise in Excel and PowerPoint

  • Superior verbal & written communication skills

  • Superior analytical & problem solving skills

  • Demonstrated ability to manage ambiguity in a difficult/stressful work environment

  • Demonstrated knowledge & experience with risk and quality control frameworks

  • Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration

Nice-to-haves

  • Formal qualifications as Graduate or Post-Graduate Level.

  • Knowledge of products and operations of Capital Markets, Investment Banking

  • Creative thought process and ability to innovate

  • Attention to detail while working with high volume of data and transactions

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Full time

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will provide leadership and support in using analytics, including advanced analytics and statistical models, to generate actionable insights, automate business actions, and improve the speed and quality of decisions across Digital teams at RBC.

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure, curate and complete analyses, develop net new data assets and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 7+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala, Google Analytics, Tableau, Data Studio and PowerPoint
  • Hands-on knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research
  • Success with building out an analysis end-to-end with a high degree of independence: i.e., perform lead requirements gathering, develop an analysis plan, wrangle data to suit the problem, apply the right type of analytics and package the output into a presentable deliverable
  • Storytelling and executive presence: ability to articulate a narrative for an analysis or report
  • Experience working on agile teams using Github and JIRA
  • Ability to work with and lead analysts and managers

Nice-to-have

  • MA, MSc or PhD in a quantitative field
  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge and experience in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Help advance a culture of timely data-driven decisions
    • Implement practical applications of analytical and statistical frameworks and methodologies to client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation, hypothesis testing and causal inference to surface actionable insights
    • Embed reliable and re-usable patterns and showcase them to drive forward the analytics brand of the Digital Intelligence Group both internally and across Digital teams at RBC

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
    • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports identifying trends, issues and opportunities 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Manage relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.title: Manager, Data Science (Credit Risk Analytics)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Science (Credit Risk Analytics)

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The GRM Risk Policy and Analytics group provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, control and communication on the nature and extent of material risks for Business Financial Services (BFS). We are looking for someone who supports the development and maintenance of scalable data stores that supply data in forms needed for business insights & analysis. As a Manager, Data Science you will contribute to the overall success of the BFS risk oversight strategies and objectives by delivering high quality risk data assets.

Portfolio Risk Oversight (PRO) is extremely dynamic and the team needs to be able to proactively uncover insights from new risk trends and processes using open source data technologies. To succeed you will have to develop and maintain strong ties with business leaders to support decision making through a combination of custom analytics and the evolution of the PRO data infrastructure. The PRO team runs a best-in-class data & analytics stack, which requires constant refinements and enhancements to provide business users with relevant and timely self-serve analytics.

What will you do?

  • Development & support of the modern data stack
  • Translate business needs into data engineering and architecture solutions
  • Design, deploy and automate data pipelines and contribute to the continual enhancement of the data engineering architecture
  • Design and develop data quality frameworks for data completeness, accuracy and integrity
  • Build data asset mappings: while building connected data, inventory critical data elements including lineage, classification, and usage.
  • Establish a process for data validation to routinely review the accuracy of reporting and analytics.
  • Facilitate data generation to knowledge delivery for entire PRO Data Infrastructure & Innovation team
  • Identify potential data sources and enhance data collection procedures to develop deep risk insights (For e.g. web scraping, geo location, etc.)

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Strong applied experience in data engineering tasks using Python. (Ex: Ingesting data from different file formats, data acquisition using APIs, data processing using Python libraries like NumPy, Panda)
  • Experience working/supporting modern data stack
  • Strong core competency SQL. Experience in writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database source
  • Experience with data processing and transformation technologies
  • Experience building pipelines in the Hadoop ecosystem. (HDFS, Hive, and Apache Spark )
  • Experience in applying data science methods to business problems.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Knowledge of machine learning and statistics, and experience working with machine learning pipelines
  • Software engineering knowledge and practices
  • Development experience in open source frameworks
  • Experience with data analytics and visualization tools such as Tableau,
  • Experience developing interactive and sophisticated dashboards using Superset or Tableau that communicate complex data insights to a diverse set of business users

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

This position will be a part of Portfolio Risk Oversight (PRO) Data Infrastructure & Innovation team. The role will develop & support modern data stack, and will be responsible for design, development & implementation of the data pipelines and workflows that enable data science efforts within PRO team, using a variety of big data platforms, languages and tools, including Hadoop, Spark, SQL, Python and Git.

The role will ensure Data pipelines are produced with the highest quality standards, metadata and validated for completeness and accuracy

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Regular

2022-11-28-08:00

item.title: Director – Corporate Deposits Pricing & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director – Corporate Deposits Pricing & Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Reporting to the Head of Revenue Management, you will be responsible for

  • Designing and optimizing process flows pertaining to internal management revenues/accounting/tax/entity setup/ to best leverage USCM deposits for enterprise funding needs;
  • Partnering with Treasury on funds transfer pricing processes, balance sheet tracking and interest rate hedging  requirements;
  • Developing business performance indicators and driving analytics regarding profitability at client, product & portfolio level, in partnership with Finance;
  • Working  with Finance to review program financials and identify revenue and cost drivers for actual and forecast
     

US Cash Management USCM) Business is a unique opportunity to build the cash management business of the future from the ground up. This is an exciting time to join a start-up function within RBC, built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling RBC to compete with new entrants in this space!

What will you do?

  • Review and optimize the booking/tax/legal structure through the revenue lens, to best leverage USCM deposits for enterprise funding needs. This requires high fluency with cross-jurisdiction (Canada & US) regulatory rules. 

  • Partner with Treasury functions and funding desks on funds transfer pricing (FTP) approach, cash movements and establish monitoring processes to ensure accurate financial booking 

  • Define objectives & key results for business performance and perform data driven analysis of profitability at client, product and portfolio level

  • Work with Finance to review program financials and identify revenue and cost drivers for actual and forecast

People Leadership & Collaboration

  • Selects, builds, and leads a high performing process optimization and performance analytics team, leveraging individual capabilities and strengths Provides coaching, mentoring and professional development that further embeds the right culture, values, and leadership behaviors Works with team members to establish goals, drive performance management, support career development and reward strong performance.

  • Ability to forge strong relationships and routines with cross functional partners to drive strong business outcomes  

  • Partner with Corporate Treasury on any process required for internal liquidity measures, balance sheet tracking, hedging and interest rate management

  • Explore firm-wide revenue opportunities through partnership with other capital markets businesses and functional partners (legal, tax, treasury, capital markets businesses, Finance, balance sheet risks) 

What do you need to succeed?

  • Graduate degree in a related field

  • In-depth knowledge of banks’ balance sheets and ability to map out liquidity sources and uses across the enterprise

  • Fluency with Canadian and US regulatory rules applicable to cross jurisdictional activities 

  • Experience in balance sheets optimization ideally cross jurisdictions 

  • Experience in Treasury/Finance Performance Management/Financial Control  

  • Experience in leading or shaping large transformational efforts

  • High degree of business and financial acumen 

  • Able to perform data-driven analytics including the synthesis of complex data into meaningful insights

  • Able to work with x-functional teams and functional partners to design an efficient process architecture that adheres to all RBC policies and controls.

  • Required: University degree in a related field

  • Strong communication skills with ability to communicate complex messages, trade-offs and tell a compelling story

  • Ability to both grasp big picture and have rigorous attention to detail

  • Comfortable working with quick turnaround times and deadlines

  • Broad network and ability to influence across the organization is critical

Preferred

  • Experience working in transaction banking at another FI 

  • US Cash Management experience 

  • Experience leading or shaping large transformational efforts 

  • Professional designation (CFA/FRM/CPA/CA/CMA)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $200,000 - $250,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USCASHMGMT

Job Summary

Provides the strategy, definition, development, delivery and support of IT systems and services as required to establish new or enhance existing business processes. Manages activities through senior managers and managers and implements corporate and divisional strategic plans and budgets.

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-01-20-08:00

Application Deadline:

We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Science (Credit Risk Analytics)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Science (Credit Risk Analytics)

Job Description

​What is the Opportunity?

The GRM Risk Policy and Analytics group provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, control and communication on the nature and extent of material risks for Business Financial Services (BFS). We are looking for someone who can drive custom risk Analytics and Insights to business partners by building and operating a modern, open source scalable platform for reporting, analytics and data science. As a Senior Manager, Data Science you will contribute to the overall success of the BFS risk oversight strategies and objectives. You are accountable for executing reporting functions, strengthening risk methodologies and evolving the analytics capabilities for the team.

Portfolio Risk Oversight (PRO) is extremely dynamic and the team needs to be able to proactively uncover insights from new risk trends and processes using open source data technologies. To succeed you will have to develop and maintain strong ties with business leaders to support decision making through a combination of custom analytics and the evolution of the PRO data infrastructure. The PRO team runs a best-in-class data & analytics stack, which requires constant refinements and enhancements to provide business users with relevant and timely self-serve analytics. You will ensure that our team is successful by leveraging the data in the best possible way. You will be a hands-on analytics practitioner and consultant to ensure that we track, maintain and analyze data in a way that leads us to optimize operational processes and make better business decisions.

What will you do?

  • Support the PRO Business Analytics & Innovation leadership in the design, coordination, execution and monitoring of key transformational initiatives
  • Partner with cross functional teams to develop an ML/data science products.
  • Lead & support the development of feature farm for machine learning and deep dive initiatives
  • Building and supporting data engineering pipelines in Python using PySpark and Apache Airflow for reporting, data science, analytics, and ad-hoc querying.
  • Lead & support the development of an open source geospatial framework to identify and report the portfolio exposure based on an adverse climate or supply chain events.
  • Support the risk data architecture, data management standards and conventions, data naming standards, and metadata standards to ensure effective availability, scalability, security, and integrity of data assets.
  • Manage and optimizes an inventory of risk data sources. Responsible for compiling, aggregating, testing and validating different data repositories/sources for the risk dashboards ensuring completeness, accuracy, timeliness and integrity of information;
  • Analyze data sources, evaluating and remediating data quality, designing and implementing data sets that can be consumed and re-used by our analytics team

 What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Statistics, or equivalent
  • At least 5 years of professional work experience in the area of Data Analytics / Data Science / Business Analytics
  • Strong experience in the big data ecosystem, with Hadoop (Hive, HDFS), Apache Spark, and NoSQL/SQL databases
  • Strong experience in developing and implementing data science techniques (predictive, prescriptive, ML etc.)
  • Strong Python programming experience especially using modules/packages such as SciKit-Learn, Pandas, SQLAlchemy , NLTK, spaCy etc.
  • Experience with Natural Language Processing and supervised/unsupervised learning methodologies.
  • Strong core competency in SQL. Experience in writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database source

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of Credit Risk Modelling techniques
  • Experience working with knowledge graphs stores (Neo4j) and surrounding semantic technology
  • Knowledge of open source Geospatial Frameworks
  • Experience working with Cloud Technologies

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program
  • Leaders who support your development through training and coaching
  • Work with a dynamic, collaborative team with ability to make a difference

Job Summary

This position will be a part of Portfolio Risk Oversight (PRO) Data Infrastructure & Innovation team. As a Senior Manager, Data Infrastructure & Innovation in PRO team you will drive custom risk analytics and insights to business partners by building and operating a modern, open source scalable platform for reporting, analytics and data science. To succeed you have extensive Data Science / Business Analytics experience with a track record of liberating and strengthening data capabilities, deeper insights and better data driven business decisions.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-12-08-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-01-28-08:00

item.title: Senior Manager Strategic Analytics and Capacity Planning
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager Strategic Analytics and Capacity Planning

Job Description

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

  • Drive data analysis and data visualization activities
  • Explore and work with complex datasets to implement complex visualizations and reports
  • Develop web apps and interactive data visualization dashboards
  • Develop data transformation workflows and automation workflows
  • Collaborate with data scientists and data modelers to scale and deploy solutions in production
  • Support project team to scale, monitor, and operate data platforms for very high availability and performance
  • Provide clear documentation of all workflows and findings for internal reproducibility

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Passion for writing high-quality, maintainable, and robust code. Curiosity and interest in data discovery and exploration.
  • 3+ years of experience with data analytics and data science. Advanced knowledge of SQL and databases
  • 2+ years of experience with Tableau
  • 2+ years of experience with Dataiku DSS development, including experience creating web apps using Dataiku DSS. Experience creating complex interactive data visualization dashboards using Python libraries such as Plotly, Bokeh
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Nice-to-have

  • Past experience in Private Banking or Wealth Management would be an asset
  • Experience with handling geospatial data using Python geopandas, shapley, or similar is a plus

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Hybrid work environment

Job Summary

The BFS Capacity Analytics team supports strategic analytics and capacity planning decisions, and provides economic insights across geographic regions in Canada, enabling BFS and Private Banking to effectively grow and deep client relationships.

In this role you will be responsible for analytics and data visualization to support informed capacity decisions, promoting our pillars of Right People, Right Place, and Right Time. You will be a key contributor in building frameworks for ML models, visual dashboards, user interfaces, and web apps to support functionality. You will also maintain and enhance the various existing ML models and solutions.
